# Aufgabe

Berechnen Sie ein lineares Modell mit tidymodels und zwar anhand des `ames` Datensatzes.

Modellgleichung: `Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = ames`.

Berechnen Sie ein multiplikatives (exponenzielles) Modell.

Rücktransformieren Sie die Log-Werte in "Roh-Dollar".


</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_745c455c992795abf5b1e6cd4af0d182'}

:::



Multiplikatives Modell:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_fc50c78798b2503f6af6762d613a11d6'}

:::


Nicht vergessen: AV-Transformation in beiden Samples!


Datensatz aufteilen:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_3b27b5b0b0cd86c8329748da34ffa128'}

:::




Modell definieren:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_413414a155b7d1d725ccd5adfa06addd'}

:::




Modell fitten:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_c738db365fbc568e0866e29de9f2b2d9'}

:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_d8eec5de4b97b4174d7a3bc7977383a8'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
stats::lm(formula = Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = data)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)  Gr_Liv_Area  
  4.8552133    0.0002437  
```
:::
:::




Modellgüte im Train-Sample:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_1ae5babb091fafe44054f60ec0c6cab1'}

:::




Modellgüte im Train-Sample:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_155d3942552765e282c1bd9cf0966fa8'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
stats::lm(formula = Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = data)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-1.02587 -0.06577  0.01342  0.07202  0.39231 

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept) 4.855e+00  7.355e-03  660.12   <2e-16 ***
Gr_Liv_Area 2.437e-04  4.648e-06   52.43   <2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.1271 on 2928 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.4842,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.484 
F-statistic:  2749 on 1 and 2928 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::
:::



R-Quadrat via easystats:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_9a0df1332dd2bd27944c9db6d8da89c4'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# R2 for Linear Regression
       R2: 0.484
  adj. R2: 0.484
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_088bed8dda750c4715b0786fcd0f2985'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 5
  term        estimate  std.error statistic p.value
  <chr>          <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>
1 (Intercept) 4.86     0.00736        660.        0
2 Gr_Liv_Area 0.000244 0.00000465      52.4       0
```
:::
:::




Vorhersagen im Test-Sample:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_936f968a0495f57048ff82b762144ac8'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 1
  .pred
  <dbl>
1  5.07
2  5.18
3  5.31
4  5.11
5  5.18
6  5.10
```
:::
:::


`preds` ist ein Tibble, also müssen wir noch die Spalte `.pred.` herausziehen, z.B. mit `pluck(preds, ".pred")`:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_bf14d3261035b6038387da0e972e3ecd'}

:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_ffeec392de06cb0ae939e8f2bb41e0dd'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 4
  Sale_Price Gr_Liv_Area preds .pred
       <dbl>       <int> <dbl> <dbl>
1       5.02         896  5.07  5.07
2       5.24        1329  5.18  5.18
3       5.60        1856  5.31  5.31
4       5.15        1056  5.11  5.11
5       5.26        1337  5.18  5.18
6       4.98         987  5.10  5.10
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_0c9ddea78b0789a2bc91c42224111156'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 3
  Sale_Price Gr_Liv_Area .pred
       <dbl>       <int> <dbl>
1       5.02         896  5.07
2       5.24        1329  5.18
3       5.60        1856  5.31
4       5.15        1056  5.11
5       5.26        1337  5.18
6       4.98         987  5.10
```
:::
:::


Oder wir binden einfach die Spalte an den Tibble:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_6088d022a94b348a576d1f6c6aafe903'}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 3
  Sale_Price Gr_Liv_Area .pred
       <dbl>       <int> <dbl>
1       5.02         896  5.07
2       5.24        1329  5.18
3       5.60        1856  5.31
4       5.15        1056  5.11
5       5.26        1337  5.18
6       4.98         987  5.10
```
:::
:::
